availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky Hickman County Court Sct.
February Term 1863

On motion of John Tittsworth ordered that he be granted a license to keep a tavern at his residence in the Town of Clinton. Whereupon the said John Tittsworth, took the oath required by law. and with H O Earle & C M Ashley his surety entered into and acknowledged bond to commonwealth of Kentucky with covenants as required by law $10 paid to clerk

A Copy Attest
G Wm Rennick C. H. C. C

State of Kentucky Hickman County Court Sct.
September Term 1863

On motion of John Tittsworth it is hereby certified that the tavern license granted him on the 3rd day of February 1863 was to authorize him to keep a tavern on lots No 16, 17, & 18 in the town of Clinton Ky

A Copy Attest
G Wm Rennick C H C C
Indictment for lot. 16.
